thread.title: Kellie Bright makes full return to EastEnders as Linda Carter comes home to find out son Lee has gone
thread.title_full: Kellie Bright makes full return to EastEnders as Linda Carter comes home to find out son Lee has gone

author: Hayley Minn
title: Kellie Bright makes full return to EastEnders as Linda Carter comes home to find out son Lee has gone
text:
Kellie Bright makes full return to EastEnders as Linda Carter comes home to find out son Lee has gone The BBC soap actress has been on maternity leave - but can she help Danny Dyer's character? Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Linda returns to EastEnders to find out Lee ain't there Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Linda Carter finally returned to EastEnders in tonight's episode - only to find out her son Lee Carter wasn't there. 
Kellie Bright has been on maternity leave - and only gave birth at the beginning of the year - but she made an early return for Danny Dyer's break. 
Returning to The Vic, Linda was shocked when she found out Lee had gone - and also set up the robbery. 
After telling her exactly what had been going on while she was away, Mick Carter confessed: "He's not only a thief and liar, but he's also a wife-beater. Kellie Bright returned as Linda (Photo: BBC) Her happiness soon turned to shock when she found out about Lee (Photo: BBC) It was only a temporary return (Photo: BBC) 
"I've been racking my brains to try and dress it up but I can't. 
"Why'd you think I didn't pay the fine? Because I couldn't!" 
Linda's return came after Jane Beale was forced to call her pal to let her know the state her husband Mick was in. 
Danny Dyer 's character has faced mounting pressure in recent weeks as his debts have piled up - no thanks to his son Lee, who he bailed out. 
And in Monday's episode, it all became too much for Mick as the tills in the Vic stopped working. Read More Mick is in a very bad way (Photo: BBC) Jane called Linda (Photo: BBC) 
After insisting he'd "sort" the money woes, he couldn't cope any more and pulled off the bar and chucked it on the floor. 
Ian Beale then offered Mick the till from the restaurant, but it fell on deaf ears. 
When Ian returned home, he told wife Jane that Mick was in a “dark place” and wouldn’t listen to him. 
She decided to takes matters into her own hands and call Linda. 
As Linda was heard saying hello, Jane said: “I think you’d better come home” 
Linda could be heard asking why and, as Jane replied, “It’s Mick”, the camera went to him sobbing on his bed. 
Viewers of the BBC soap were very over the moon to get Kellie back on their screens. Read More Linda went again (Photo: BBC) 
One said: "So glad Linda's back." 
Another added: "I've actually missed Linda on EastEnders." 
A third agreed: "Yaaa Linda! I need a strong female presence this evening!" 
*EastEnders continues on BBC One tomorrow at 8pm Like us on Facebook
